Articles.Content:
**Little Joe - August 21, 1959**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tGDLaMKi6SI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

This is my re-createment of the Little Joe Launch . . . it was almost like the Kerbals were involved.

Here is a little history: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Joe_1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Joe_1)

- - - Updated - - -

**Big Joe - September 9, 1959**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ym5PGt6KZZg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

The Big Joe 1 Launch - September 9, 1959

A Partial Failure when the Final Stage didn't light off. RCS was required to seperate the Mercury Spacecraft.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-23T14:59:49Z" title="05/23/2015 02:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 23, 2015</time> by gsamelon**
Can someone tell me how to embed the youtube videos please.

To embed a video use the Insert Video button:

![NONdogV.png](http://i.imgur.com/NONdogV.png)

You'll then have to paste in a link to your YouTube video. You need to paste in a link like this, which you usually get by clicking on the video name in YouTube:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-ASxp81UXjw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

You *don't* want a link like this, which is the one you get by using YouTube's Share section:

[https://youtu.be/-ASxp81UXjw](https://youtu.be/-ASxp81UXjw)

You can see what it looks like in my last post [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/122626-Part-2-of-Our-Epic-Jool-Mission?p=1963656).
